thread.title: Friday Night Recap: Southern Boone flips the script on California
thread.title_full: Friday Night Recap: Southern Boone flips the script on California

author: Camal Petro
title: Friday Night Recap: Southern Boone flips the script on California
text:
Share 
CALIFORNIA, Mo. — The rematch between Southern Boone and California didn’t quite go exactly the way it went four weeks ago when the teams first met in conference play. 
Not only did the Pintos win a close, low-scoring 20-12 contest last month, but the Eagles got the better of California this time around in a game that saw 69 combined points. Southern Boone forced seven California turnovers and rushed for 310 yards on 52 carries to beat California 48-21 Friday night and advance in the Class 3 District 6 playoffs. 
“Tonight didn’t go like we wanted of course, but sometimes adversity like that pops up,” California head coach Marty Albertson said. “You’re not going to beat any good teams with seven turnovers.” 
The Pintos’ offense struggled to gain any traction to start the game. Quarterback Jacob Wolken threw an interception on the opening possession, then California had fumbles on three of its next five drives. 
Despite all of the early mishaps, the Eagles only held a 12-0 lead after the fourth turnover in the first half. 
After Wolken threw his first interception that gave Southern Boone the ball at the Pintos’ 30-yard line, Laron Wallace scored four plays later from the 5. 
Wallace scored again one play after the Eagles recovered a California fumble — its third turnover — early in the second quarter. The 15-yard run gave Southern Boone a 12-0 lead. 
The Pintos’ defense was on the field for most of the second and third quarters, as Southern Boone added two more touchdowns during that span. 
“I thought the defense played well in the first half,” Albertson said. “They got worn out the second half, basically.” 
The Eagles moved the ball 59 yards on eights plays to extend the lead to 18-0 before halftime. Quarterback Spencer Taggart and receiver Gannon Mueller connected on a receiver screen pass for a 17-yard touchdown. 
“It seemed like they had the ball the whole first half and we didn’t have it very much, and when we did have it, we turned it over,” Albertson said. 
To start the third quarter, Southern Boone took seven minutes off the clock as the Eagles moved down the field for the touchdown and a 26-0 lead. A fake punt on a fourth-and-5 helped the cause, as Mueller took the snap and rushed up the middle for a 35-yard gain. 
California answered with a quick touchdown drive — albeit its longest of the day — to cut the lead to 26-7. Josh Woodruff took a pitch from Wolken for 29 yards, the Wolken found receiver Landon Mouse for a 16-yard gain to move the ball into the red zone. Two plays later, Wolken completed a pass to a wide-open Mouse in the end zone for a 17-yard score. 
The teams traded touchdowns for the rest of the game. 
Southern Boone’s Tanner Smith scored from the 1-yard line to push the Eagles’ lead to 34-7, then Wolken needed just two plays to find receiver Ethan Hodges over the middle. Hodges hauled in a one-handed catch and sprinted to the end zone to make it a 34-14 game. 
A Taggart to Trevor Garriott 3-yard connection gave the Eagles a 42-14 lead, then Woodruff completed a 73-yard halfback pass to Hodges late in the fourth quarter for the score. 
“They played us basically man-up the whole time across,” Albertson said. “They were giving us the short throw most of the time and we burned them deep a couple of times later on, but it was way too late by that time.” 
Southern Boone’s Brandon Bowden iced the game with a 5-yard touchdown run to provide the final margin. 
Southern Boone (6-4) will play at 7 p.m. Friday at Fulton (8-2), while California ends at 6-4. ﻿
